meanings.sent1: The doctor trepanned the patient to relieve pressure in the skull.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon trepanned the skull to remove a blood clot.
meanings.sent3: The medical student mistakenly trepanned a watermelon during practice.
meanings.sent4: She trepanned the mystery of human behavior with insightful questions.
meanings.sent5: The ancient practice of trepanning was believed to release evil spirits from the body.

meanings.definition: To perforate (the skull) with a trepan.
meanings.sent1: The ancient tribes used sharp tools to trepan the skull for rituals.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist discovered a skull that had been trepanned centuries ago.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy carpenter accidentally trepanned his thumb with a nail.
meanings.sent4: His words trepanned deep into her thoughts, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The idea of trepanning the skull for medical purposes dates back to ancient times.
